Articles.Content: Umm KSP just stopped working. When l open up KSP there is only a yellow bar and doesn't go up. l try to reinstall KSP it's same but it worked correct before.

KSP the yellow bar is a loading bar. You will have to wait for it to complete loading. If it doesn’t load restart your PS4 and restart the application KSP. If it’s on a computer get in touch with the KSP Support guys on the KSP website.

On 10/10/2020 at 12:13 AM, Dr. Kerbal said:

KSP the yellow bar is a loading bar. You will have to wait for it to complete loading. If it doesn’t load restart your PS4 and restart the application KSP. If it’s on a computer get in touch with the KSP Support guys on the KSP website.

I know but it doesn't go up when l wait 1min or long and it worked find weeks ago

On 10/9/2020 at 2:18 PM, MCexpert2011 said:

Umm KSP just stopped working. When l open up KSP there is only a yellow bar and doesn't go up. l try to reinstall KSP it's same but it worked correct before.      

We need log files to investigate this. Look for C:/users/your-username/AppData/LocalLow/Squad/Kerbal Space Program/player.log and also the KSP.log file inside the KSP directory, upload to a file sharing site of your choice then post links to them here.

Freezing on the load screen usually indicates an exception has occurred and the game can’t load, which is why the log files are so important as they’ll contain details of what’s going on and why.

On 10/13/2020 at 8:58 PM, jimmymcgoochie said:

We need log files to investigate this. Look for C:/users/your-username/AppData/LocalLow/Squad/Kerbal Space Program/player.log and also the KSP.log file inside the KSP directory, upload to a file sharing site of your choice then post links to them here.

Freezing on the load screen usually indicates an exception has occurred and the game can’t load, which is why the log files are so important as they’ll contain details of what’s going on and why.

l can't find a AppData

4 hours ago, MCexpert2011 said:

l can't find a AppData

I should probably have mentioned that- AppData is a hidden folder, you need to enable 'show hidden' to see it. You can also paste C:/users/your-username/AppData/LocalLow/Squad/Kerbal Space Program directly into windows explorer (with 'your-username' replaced with your real PC username, obviously) and it should take you to that folder.
